conbody.p: If a high-priority event, such as an incoming call, occurs when a menu list is open, the list is cancelled and the new event takes control. These lists are often displayed inside a pop-up window.
The default keypad functions in a menu list are the following:

table.title: Default key events in a menu list

entry.p: Moves the focus in the list.
Ignored (unless there is a submenu; see Submenus).
Selects the item, does the associated function.
Selects the item, does the associated function.
Dismisses the menu; returns to the state preceding the opening of the menu.
Dismiss the menu and do the default action of the key.

section.title: Using menu lists in C++ applications
section.p: The API to use for menu lists is the Lists API. For implementation information, see Using the Lists API.
